sen.j: 快慶（かいけい、生没年未詳）は、鎌倉時代に活動した仏師。
sen.e: Kaikei (birth/death dates unknown) was a Busshi, Sculptor of Buddhist Statues in the Kamakura era.
sen.cmt: 仏師の英訳の参照[http://www.onmarkproductions.com/html/who-made-buddha-statues-japan-busshi.html]仏師という日本語特有の単語を、イタリックでBusshiと表示し、最初のみ訳を詳細な”Sculptor of Buddhist Statue”に、その後は簡略なBuddhist sculptorという風に訳させて頂きました。
sen.e: Kaikei (birth/death dates unknown) was a Busshi, Sculptor of Buddhist Statues, of the Kamakura period (1185-1333.)
sen.cmt: in'→'of'Added dates of Kamakura 'era'→'period'
sen.e: Kaikei (birth/death dates unknown) was a Busshi, Sculptor of Buddhist Statues, of the Kamakura period (1185-1333).
sen.cmt: 仕様書に基づきBusshiのイタリック体を解除し、ピリオドの位置を移動

sen.j: 運慶とともに鎌倉時代を代表する仏師の一人である。
sen.e: He was one of the Buddhist sculptors who represented the Kamakura-era along with Unkei.
He was one of the leading Buddhist sculptors,along with Unkei, of the Kamakura-era.
sen.cmt: Changed word order'who represented'→'leading'
sen.e: He was one of the leading Buddhist sculptors, along with Unkei, of the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを消去、カンマの位置を移動、Kamakura-era→Kamakura periodに修正

sen.j: この流派の仏師は多く名前に慶の字を用いるところから慶派と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Since many of this school's Buddhist sculptors used the character KEI in their names, the school is called "KEI-ha (KEI school)".
Since many of this school's Buddhist sculptors used the character KEI in their names, the school is known as "KEI-ha (KEI school)".
sen.cmt: called'→'known as'
sen.e: Since many of this school's Buddhist sculptors used the character KEI in their names, the school is known as KEI-ha (KEI school).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを削除

sen.j: 快慶は安阿弥陀仏とも称し、その理知的、絵画的で繊細な作風は「安阿弥様」（あんなみよう）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Kaikei is also called Annamidabutsu, and his intellective and picturesque delicate style is called "Annnami-yo (Annnami Style)".
Kaikei was also called Annamidabutsu, and his intelligent, picturesque and delicate style is called "Annami-yo (Annnami Style)".
sen.cmt: is'→'was''intellective'→'intelligent'― literal translation is 'intellectual' but maybe 'intelligent' is betterMoved 'and'deleted 'n'
sen.e: Kaikei was also called Annamidabutsu, and his intelligent, picturesque and delicate style is called 'Annami-yo' (Annami Style).
sen.cmt: "Annami-yo (Annnami Style)".→'Annami-yo' (Annami Style).に修正

sen.j: 三尺前後の阿弥陀如来像の作例が多く、在銘の現存作も多い。
sen.e: Many of his works are images of Amida-Nyorai (Amitabha) standing around 3 feet (approx. 100 cm), and there are many which still exist.
sen.cmt: 尺は、1尺を約１フィート・0.333mmで換算し、表示させて頂きました。参照[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shaku]
sen.e: Many of his works are images of Amida-Nyorai (Amitabha) standing around 3 feet (approx. 100 cm), and there are many still in existance.
sen.cmt: which still exist'→'still in existance.
sen.e: Many of his works are images of Amida-Nyorai (Amitabha) standing around three feet (approx. 100 cm), and there are many still in existance.
sen.cmt: "3"をスペルアウト

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 快慶の生没年や出自は明らかでない。
sen.e: Kaikei's birth and death dates are not known.
Kaikei's birth and death dates are not known.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: Kaikei's birth and death dates are not known.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 史料上の初見は寿永2年（1183年）の「運慶願経」である。
sen.e: The first reference to Kaikei occurs in "Unkei Gangyo" of 1183.
The first reference to Kaikei occurs in "Unkei Gangyo" from 1183.
sen.cmt: of'→'from'
sen.e: The first reference to Kaikei occurs in 'Unkei Gangyo' from 1183.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 「運慶願経」とは、仏師運慶が願主となって制作された法華経である。
sen.e: "Unkei Gangyo" is the Hokke-kyo (Lotus Sutra) transcribed by the sculptor Unkei, who became the temple petitioner.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: "Unkei Gangyo" is the Hokke-kyo (Lotus Sutra) transcribed by the sculptor Unkei after he became a temple petitioner.
sen.cmt: , who'→'after he'
sen.e: Unkei Gangyo' is the Hokke-kyo (Lotus Sutra) transcribed by the sculptor Unkei after he became a temple petitioner.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 全8巻のうち巻一は亡失、巻二から巻七が京都・真正極楽寺蔵、巻八が個人蔵（ともに国宝）となっている。
sen.e: Out of the full eight volumes, Vol.1 was lost, Vol.2-Vol.7 are kept in Shinsho Gokuraku-ji Temple in Kyoto and Vol.8 is owned privately (all of them are Japanese National Treasures).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Out of the full eight volumes, Vol.1 was lost, Vol.2-Vol.7 are kept in Shinsho Gokuraku-ji Temple in Kyoto and Vol.8 is privately owned (all of them are Japanese National Treasures).
sen.cmt: Moved 'privately'
sen.e: Out of the full eight volumes, Volume One was lost, Volume Two to Volume Seven are kept in Shinsho Gokuraku-ji Temple in Kyoto and Volume Eight is privately owned (all of them are Japanese National Treasures).
sen.cmt: Vol.1→Volume One, Vol.2-Vol.7→Volume Two to Volume Seven, Vol.8→Volume Eightとしました。

sen.j: この巻八末尾の奥書に結縁者の一人として「快慶」の名が見える。
sen.e: In the postscript at the end of volume eight, Kaikei's name appears as one of Keichiensha (the person establishing a tie with Buddha, in order to be entitled to his benefits).
sen.cmt: 結縁者の参照は、http://www.answers.com/topic/kaikei です。
sen.e: In the postscript at the end of volume eight, Kaikei's name appears as one of the Keichiensha (a person who participates in, and contributes to, Buddhist practices).
sen.cmt: Added 'the'Changed explanation of 'Keichiensha'
sen.e: In the postscript at the end of volume eight, Kaikei's name appears as one of the Keichiensha (a person who participates in, and contributes to, Buddhist practices).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 現存する作品のうちもっとも古いものはボストン美術館蔵（旧興福寺）の弥勒菩薩立像で文治5年（1189年）の作である。
sen.e: His oldest existing work is the statue produced in 1189 of Miroku Bosatsu, the Bodhisattva of the Future, located at the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (ex-collection of Kofuku-ji Temple.)
sen.cmt: 参照は[http://www.onmarkproductions.com/html/busshi-buddha-sculptor-kaikei-japan.html]です。
sen.e: His oldest existing work is a statue produced in 1189 of Miroku Bosatsu, the Bodhisattva of the Future, located at the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (formerly in the collection of Kofuku-ji Temple.)
sen.cmt: the'→'a''ex-'→'formerly in the '
sen.e: His oldest existing work is a standing statue of Miroku Bosatsu, the Bodhisattva of the Future, produced in 1189, located at the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston (formerly in the collection of Kofuku-ji Temple).
sen.cmt: 「立像」→a standing statueとし、"produced in 1189"の位置を移動、ピリオドの位置を移動

sen.j: この作品には、理知的な表情、細身の体型、絵画的に処理された衣文など、快慶の特徴的な作風がすでに現れている。
sen.e: This work already appeared with Kaikei's characteristic style, including the intellectual face expression, the slim build body and the picturesquely curved robe.
In this work, Kaikei's characteristic style, including the intelligent facial expression, the slim build body and the picturesquely curved robe, is already apparent
sen.cmt: already appeared with'→'is already apparent' and moved to end'intellectual face'→'intelligent facial'
sen.e: In this work, Kaikei's characteristic style, including the intelligent facial expression, the slim build body and the picturesquely curved robe, is already apparent.
sen.cmt: ピリオド追加

sen.j: 現存する2番目の作品である醍醐寺三宝院弥勒菩薩坐像（建久3年・1192年）からは作品に「巧匠アン阿弥陀仏」（「安」は梵字）と銘記するようになる。
sen.e: From the second oldest existing work, which is the sedentary statue of Miroku Bosatsu, Sanboin, Daigo-ji Temple (1192), he started using the inscription "Artisan AN AMIDA BUTSU" (writing AN in Sanskrit.)

From the second oldest existing work, which is a sedentary statue of Miroku Bosatsu (Maitreya Boddhisatva) in Sanboin, Daigo-ji Temple (1192), he started using the inscription "Artisan AN AMIDA BUTSU" (writing AN in Sanskrit.)
sen.cmt: the'→'a'Added definition of 'Miroku Bosatsu'added 'in'
sen.e: From the second oldest existing work, which is a seated statue of Miroku Bosatsu in Sanboin, Daigo-ji Temple (1192), he started using the inscription 'Artisan AN AMIDA BUTSU' (writing AN in Sanskrit.)
sen.cmt: Miroku Bosatsuは既出のため補足を削除、統一リストに基づきsedentary statue→seated statueに修正、シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 快慶風の様式の仏像を「安阿弥様」というのはこれによる。
sen.e: This is the reason why Kaikei-style Buddhist statues are called "Annamiyo (Annami style)".
The name "Annamiyo (Annami style)" for Kaikei-style Buddhist statues comes from the AN AMI part of this inscription.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence to to make the source of
sen.e: The name 'Annamiyo' (Annami style) for Kaikei-style Buddhist statues comes from the AN AMI part of this inscription.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーション変更、位置を移動

sen.j: この銘記は快慶が法橋の僧位に任じられる建仁3年（1203年）まで続く。
sen.e: This inscription continued to be used till 1203 when Kaikei was awarded the priestly rank of Hokkyo.
He continued using this inscription till 1203 when he was awarded the priestly rank of Hokkyo.
sen.cmt: This inscription continued to be used'→'He continued using this inscription''Kaikei'→'he'
sen.e: He continued using this inscription till 1203 when he was awarded the priestly rank of Hokkyo (the third highest rank for Buddhist priests).
sen.cmt: Hokkyoの補足を追加

sen.j: 快慶は日本の中世以前の仏師の中では例外的に多くの作品に銘記を残している。
sen.e: Kaikei left his inscriptions on many of his works, which was unusual for the Buddhist sculptors prior to the Japanese Middle Ages.
Kaikei left his inscriptions on many of his works, which was unusual for Buddhist sculptors prior to the Japanese Middle Ages.
sen.cmt: Deleted 'the'
sen.e: Kaikei left his inscriptions on many of his works, which was unusual for Buddhist sculptors prior to the Japanese Middle Ages.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 自ら「巧匠」と名乗っていることとも合わせ、快慶は「作者」としての意識の強い仏師であったことがうかがわれる。
sen.e: With the fact that he signed himself as "Artisan", it is obvious that Kaikei was a sculptor who was very conscious as an "Artist".
By signing his works "Artisan", it is clear that Kaikei was a sculptor who was very conscious of his position as an "Artist".
sen.cmt: With the fact that he signed himself as'→'By signing his works''obvious'→'clear'Added 'of his position'
sen.e: By signing his works 'Artisan,' it is clear that Kaikei was a sculptor who was very conscious of his position as an 'Artist.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーション変更、カンマ・ピリオドの位置を移動

sen.j: また「アン阿弥陀仏」と称し、阿弥陀如来像を多数残していることから、熱心な阿弥陀信仰者であったことがわかる。
sen.e: Also, calling himself "An Amida Butsu" and leaving many Amida Nyorai statues, shows that he was a devoted Amida follower.
Also, calling himself "An Amida Butsu" and leaving many Amida Nyorai statues shows that he was a devoted Amida follower.
sen.cmt: deleted comma
sen.e: Also, calling himself 'An Amida Butsu' and leaving many Amida Nyorai statues shows that he was a devoted Amida follower.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーション変更

sen.j: 快慶は運慶とともに、平重衡の兵火（治承4年・1180年）で壊滅的な被害を受けた東大寺、興福寺など南都の大寺院の復興造仏事業にたずさわった。
sen.e: With Unkei, Kaikei was involved in the rebuilding project of major temples of Nanto, including Todai-ji Temple and Koufuku-ji Temple, which sustained devastating damage by fire as caused by TAIRA no Shigehira's attack on 1180.
sen.cmt: 原文通りに訳させていただきましたが、南都の実際の地名「奈良」を記した方がより理解しやすいのでは無いかと思われます。[http://dictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/jn/146310/m0u/%E5%8D%97%E9%83%BD/]
sen.e: With Unkei, Kaikei was involved in the rebuilding project of major temples in Nara, including Todai-ji Temple and Koufuku-ji Temple, which had sustained devastating damage when TAIRA no Shigehira ordered the burning of the city in 1180.
sen.cmt: of Nanto'→'in Nara'―agree with translator's commentAdded 'had''by fire as caused by TAIRA no Shigehira's attack on'→'when TAIRA no Shigehira ordered the burning of the city in'
sen.e: With Unkei, Kaikei was involved in the rebuilding project of major temples in Nara, including Todai-ji Temple and Koufuku-ji Temple, which had sustained devastating damage when TAIRA no Shigehira ordered the burning of the city in 1180.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 建久5年（1194年）には東大寺中門の二天像のうち多聞天像を担当したが、これは現存しない。
sen.e: In 1194, he was in charge of the statue of Tamon-ten, one of Ni-ten statues of Todai-ji Temple Chu-mon (Middle Gate), however, it no longer exists.
In 1194, he was in charge of the statue (which is no longer extant) of Tamon-ten, one of the two Ni-ten statues of Todai-ji Temple's Chu-mon (Inner Gate).
sen.cmt: however, it no longer exists'→'(which is no longer extant)' and moved to near start of sentenced.'Middle'→'Inner'
sen.e: In 1194, he was in charge of the statue (which is no longer extant) of Tamon-ten, one of the Ni-ten (Two Guardian Kings) statues of Todai-ji Temple's Chu-mon Gate (Inner gate).
sen.cmt: two Ni-ten statues→Ni-ten (Two Guardian Kings) statues、およびChu-mon Gate (Inner gate)としました。

sen.j: 建仁3年（1203年）には東大寺南大門の金剛力士（仁王）像の造営に運慶らとともに参加している。
sen.e: In 1203, he participated with Unkei and others in producing the statue of Kongo Rikishi (Nio) at Todai-ji Temple Nandai-mon (South gate).
In 1203, he participated with Unkei and others in producing the statue of Kongo Rikishi (Nio) at Todai-ji Temple Nandai-mon (South gate).
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: In 1203, he participated with Unkei and others in producing the statue of Kongo Rikishi (Nio) at Todai-ji Temple Nandai-mon Gate (Great south gate).
sen.cmt: Nandai-mon Gate (Great south gate)としました。

sen.j: 快慶は東大寺大仏再興の大勧進（総責任者）であった俊乗坊重源（しゅんじょうぼうちょうげん）と関係が深かった。
sen.e: Kaikei had a strong tie with the monk, Shunjobo-chogen, who was the Daikanjin (chief person in charge) during the restoration of Daibustsu (Big Buddha) of Todai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: Daibutsu (Big Buddha) ［http://www.onmarkproductions.com/html/big-buddha-japan.shtml］一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kaikei was very close the monk, Shunjobo-Chogen, who was the Daikanjin (chief person in charge) during the restoration of Daibustsu (Big Buddha) of Todai-ji Temple and
sen.cmt: had a strong tie with'→'was very close to'Re-made one sentence.
sen.e: Kaikei was very close the monk, Shunjobo-Chogen, who was the Daikanjin (chief person in charge) during the restoration of Daibutsu (Big Buddha) of Todai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: andを削除、文末にピリオド追加、Daibustsu→Daibutsuに修生（原文もピリオドで終わるよう文末を変更しました）

sen.j: 東大寺の僧形八幡神坐像、同寺俊乗堂阿弥陀如来立像など、重源関係の造像が多い。
sen.e: There are many statues related to Chogen such as Todai-ji Temple's Zoukei Hachimanshin sedentary statue and Todai-ji Temple Shunjobodo hall Amida Nyorai standing statue.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: there are many statues related to Chogen, such as Todai-ji Temple's Zoukei Hachimanshin sedentary statue and the Amida Nyorai standing statue in Todai-ji Temple's Shunjobodo hall.
sen.cmt: Re-made one sentence.Changed word order
sen.e: There are many statues related to Chogen, such as Todai-ji Temple's Sogyo Hachimanshin seated statue and the Amida Nyorai standing statue in Todai-ji Temple's Shunjobodo hall.
sen.cmt: 文頭の頭文字を大文字に変更、Zoukei Hachimanshin→Sogyo Hachimanshin、sedentary statue→seated statueに修正

sen.j: 三重・新大仏寺の如来像（もと阿弥陀三尊像だが、江戸時代の土砂崩れで脇侍が失われ、本尊も体部が大破したため、頭部をもとに盧舎那仏坐像に改造）、兵庫・浄土寺 (小野市)の阿弥陀三尊像なども、重源が設置した東大寺別所の造像である。
sen.e: The Nyorai-zo statue at Shindaibutsu-ji Temple in Mie (used to be the Amida Sanzon-zou statues. However, the side samurai were lost in the land slide in Edo and both idol and body were damaged badly, then remodeled based on the head part as Birushana-butsu (Birushana Buddha) sedentary statue.), and Amida Sanzon-zou Statue of Jodo-ji Temple in Ono City, Hyogo, are also statues of the Todai-ji Temple branch established by Chogen.

The Nyorai-zo statue (which used to be the Amida Sanzon-zou statues until the side samurai were lost, and the main statue and base badly damaged, in an Edo landslide, the head later being remodeled based on that of the Birushana-butsu (Birushana Buddha) sedentary statue) at Shindaibutsu-ji Temple in Mie and the Amida Sanzon-zou Statue of Jodo-ji Temple in Ono City, Hyogo, are also statues from the Todai-ji Temple branch established by Chogen.
sen.cmt: Reworked sentence in bracketsAdded 'the''of'→'from'
sen.e: The Nyorai statue (which used to be the Amida Sanzon (Amida Triad) statues until the side samurai were lost, and the main statue and base badly damaged, in an Edo landslide, the head later being remodeled based on that of the Birushana-butsu (Birushana Buddha) seated statue) at Shindaibutsu-ji Temple in Mie and the Amida Sanzon statues of Jodo-ji Temple in Ono City, Hyogo, are also statues from the Todai-ji Temple branch established by Chogen.
sen.cmt: Nyorai-zo statue→Nyorai statue、Amida Sanzon-zou statues→Amida Sanzon (Amida Triad; 初出のみ) statues、sedentary statue→seated statueとしました。

sen.j: 快慶の作品は、銘記や関係史料から真作と判明しているものだけで40件近く現存し、制作年が明らかなものも多い。
sen.e: There are over 40 existing Kaikei's works which were verified as his own work from his inscription, or from historic materials, though the year of production for many is unclear.
There are over 40 works in existence that have been authenticated as Kaikei's work, either from his inscription or from historic documents, though the year of production for many is unclear.
sen.cmt: Reworded 1st clauseAdded 'either' Deleted comma'materials'→'documents'
sen.e: There are over 40 works in existence that have been authenticated as Kaikei's work, either from his inscription or from historic documents, though the year of production for many is unclear.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、東大寺、興福寺、醍醐寺のような大寺院だけでなく、由緒の明らかでない小寺院にも快慶の作品が残されている。
sen.e: Kaikei's works are also left not only at the major temples such as Todai-ji Temple, Kofuku-ji Temple or Godai-ji Temple, but even at small temples of which the pedigree is unsure.
Kaikei's works are left not only at major temples such as Todai-ji Temple, Kofuku-ji Temple or Godai-ji Temple, but also at small temples with unclear histories.
sen.cmt: deleted 'also'Deleted 'the''of which the pedigree is unsure'→'with unclear histories'
sen.e: Kaikei's works are left not only at major temples such as Todai-ji Temple, Kofuku-ji Temple or Daigo-ji Temple, but also at small temples with unclear histories.
sen.cmt: Godai-ji Temple→Daigo-ji Templeに訂正

sen.j: 快慶の没年は明らかでない。
sen.e: Kaikei's year of death is not clear.
Kaikei's year of death is not clear.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Kaikei's year of death is not clear.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ただし、京都府城陽市・極楽寺の阿弥陀如来立像（快慶の弟子・行快の作）の胎内から発見された文書に嘉禄3年（1227年）の年紀と、この時点で快慶が故人であったことが記されており、この年が快慶死去の下限となる。
sen.e: However, the document found inside the womb of Amida Nyorai standing statue (by Koukai, Kaikei's disciple) of Gokuraku-ji Temple, Joyo City, Kyoto Prefecture, mentioned the year 1227 and Kaikei being deceased by then, so this is the limit for his year of death.

However, a document found inside the Amida Nyorai standing statue (by Kaikei's disciple, Koukai) at Gokuraku-ji Temple, Joyo City, Kyoto Prefecture, mentioned that Kaikei was already dead in 1227, so this is the limit for his year of death.
sen.cmt: the'→'a'Removed 'the womb' ― do statues have wombs?'of'→'at''the year 1227 and Kaikei being deceased by then'→'that Kaikei was already dead in 1227'
sen.e: However, a document found inside the Amida Nyorai standing statue (by Kaikei's disciple, Kokai) at Gokuraku-ji Temple, Joyo City, Kyoto Prefecture, mentioned that Kaikei was already dead in 1227, so this is the limit for his year of death.
sen.cmt: Koukai→Kokaiに修正

sen.j: 銘記等から真作と確認されているものの一覧である。
sen.e: This is the list of work, verified as real from inscriptions, etc.
This is a list of authenticated works.
sen.cmt: verified as real from inscriptions, etc.'→'authenticated'
sen.e: This is a list of authenticated works.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「重文」は「重要文化財（国指定）」の略。
sen.e: "Jubun" is the abbreviation for "Juyou Bunkazai (Kuni-shitei) - Important Cultural Properties (National nominated)"
sen.cmt: この文章は訳しましたが、実際の作品リストの中で「Jubun」という言い方はせずに、そのまま「Important Cultural Properties」としております。
sen.e: "Jubun" is the abbreviation for "Juyou Bunkazai (Kuni-shitei) - Important Cultural Properties (National nominated)"
sen.cmt: Since this sentence is an explanation of a Japanese abbreviation that isn't used in the English, I don't think it is necessary.
sen.e: Jubun' is the abbreviation for 'Juyou Bunkazai' (Kuni-shitei) - Important Cultural Properties (National nominated)
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、位置を移動

sen.j: 初期（「仏師快慶」銘）
sen.e: Early time ("Sculptor Kaikei" sign)
Early period (Pieces signed "Sculptor Kaikei")
sen.cmt: time'→'period' '"Sculptor Kaikei" sign'→'Pieces signed "Sculptor Kaikei"'
